ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4

Class GL4ZBufferState

  • java.lang.Object
    • ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4.GL4AbstractRenderState
      • ray.rage.rendersystem.gl4.GL4ZBufferState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable, RenderState, ZBufferState

    public final class GL4ZBufferState
extends GL4AbstractRenderState
implements ZBufferState
    A concrete implementation of the z-buffer-state interface for a GL4RenderSystem.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera

      • setTestEnabled

        public void setTestEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Description copied from interface: ZBufferState
        Sets whether depth-testing should be performed on every fragment or not.

        This should not be confused with enabling/disabling render-state itself, which would determine whether this gets applied or not. Enabling/Disabling z-buffer testing simply determines whether fragments should or should not be tested at all.

        For example, disabling the render-state would mean that subsequent fragments will be processed using the last z-state to have been applied, whereas disabling depth-testing itself will update overwrite the previous state.

        Specified by:
        setTestEnabled in interface ZBufferState

      • hasTestEnabled

        public boolean hasTestEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: ZBufferState
        Gets whether depth-testing is being performed or not.
        Specified by:
        hasTestEnabled in interface ZBufferState
        Returns:
        true if depth-testing is being performed. Otherwise false.
        See Also:

      • notifyDispose

        public void notifyDispose()
        Description copied from interface: Disposable
        Explicitly releases the internal resources held by this instance, making it unusable afterwards.

        WARNING: This method is meant to be used internally by the framework and not by game clients. Use directly only if you really know what you're doing.

        Specified by:
        notifyDispose in interface Disposable
        Overrides:
        notifyDispose in class GL4AbstractRenderState

      • applyImpl

        protected void applyImpl(com.jogamp.opengl.GL4 gl)
        Description copied from class: GL4AbstractRenderState
        Abstract method to be implemented by a concrete render-state. It actually applies the render-state.

        This is an example of the Template Method design pattern.

        Specified by:
        applyImpl in class GL4AbstractRenderState
        Parameters:
        gl - The GL4 object, from the JOGL bindings.
        See Also:
        GL4AbstractRenderState.apply()

      • disposeImpl

        protected void disposeImpl(com.jogamp.opengl.GL4 gl)
        Description copied from class: GL4AbstractRenderState
        Abstract method to be implemented by a concrete render-state. It actually destroys the render-state.

        This is an example of the Template Method design pattern.

        Specified by:
        disposeImpl in class GL4AbstractRenderState
        Parameters:

        See Also:
